intro: Malacothamnus aboriginum, commonly known as the Australian fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Malacothamnus aboriginum is well adapted to arid conditions and is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value.
